learning_outcomes.description: Describe factors that influence communication, and how individual differences influence communication outcomes and group collaboration
Compare methods available to facilitate group interaction, planning and action.
Apply the principles and processes of group development and dynamics
Explain group processes and negotiation skills in group problem solving and conflict management situations
Appraise what makes an effective group member and leader within diverse team settings

assessments.assessment_title: Participation in discussions and group activities
assessments.due_date:
28/07/2025 - 20/10/2025

Each week (from week 1 to week 12), submitted in class as per the timetabled class.
assessments.task_description:
Each week (from week 1 to week 12), there will be a series of activities within the ‘workshop style’ integrated lectures and tutorials. The topic of each activity will be based on the content of each weeks’ lecture. Activities may involve small group work, personal reflection, quizzes, and/or large group discussions. It is essential for students to attend the workshops to be able to gain the most from this experience. For students unable to attend an in-person session for reasons beyond their control, please submit an extension request and if approved, an online option such as a quiz will be provided via blackboard after the session.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

The use of AI or MT must be acknowledged appropriately. Please see assessment guidelines in blackboard course site for specific instructions.

assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Group analysis - Applying theory in practice
assessments.task_description:
This task involves using skills developed in the workshops to examine and discuss a real-life example of group dynamics and function. Although being about a group, this is an individual-level assessment, and will involve submitting a brief written report. Further details of the assessment will be provided in Week 2.
